1126166304111640577.text: Reichsbuergers typically share the conviction that German society is being pushed to the breaking point, and that there is an urgent need to prepare for an inevitable “Day X” of confrontation with the state.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126166113816018945.text: Unlike more prominent forces on Germany’s rising far-right scene, the Reichsbuergers are not an organized group but rather a sprawling, leaderless underground movement of individuals and small groups with divergent takes on the arcane conspiracy theory.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165697539788800.text: At its core, it’s an anti-Semitic ideology, with adherents forming their worldview through the myth of a global Jewish plot to oppress and eradicate the Germans through immigration. Many in the scene are Holocaust deniers.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165543340343296.text: The ideology has Nazi roots, and was initially circulated by Nazi Party holdovers in the years following World War II. http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165279749357568.text: “Reichsbuerger" is an ideology rooted in the conspiracy theory that the German Reich still exists, and that the post-war German federal republic is an illegitimate puppet state established by foreign occupying powers to oppress the German people.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165190381322241.text: “If you were to seriously believe what they do, you’d take a shotgun and hide it in your cellar as well.”http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165185801195520.text: “If you were to seriously believe what they do, you’d take a shotgun and hide it in your cellar as well.”http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126165061863604224.text: Like so many other conspiracy theories, the Reichsbuerger ideology proliferates predominantly in the swamps of the internet, but there are worrying signs that it is seeping from the lunatic fringe into wider society.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126164977902129152.text: In June 2017, the government resolved to disarm the movement, declaring that anyone who identifies as a Reichsbuerger should be banned from possessing a weapon.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126164851473051648.text: Worryingly, they tend to have guns; 5 percent of Reichsbuergers hold gun permits, compared to 2 percent of the general population.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126164784896978946.text: Since Germany’s intelligence service began surveillance of the Reichsbuergers in 2016, its estimate of the movement’s size has doubled to around 19,000 members.http://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1126164603988324352.text: NEW: Inside the far-right conspiracy movement that's preparing for a showdown with Germany's governmenthttp://bit.ly/2HcKRIJ

1122873819830661120.text: A current Fox employee lamented to VICE News that the network forged this deep, digital connection with its audience through the same blend of tabloid-y headlines and political outrage that plays well on cable news and talk radio.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122873758782578688.text: Fox News is also still ballooning: Its content drew about 20 million more interactions across Facebook in March compared to January 2018.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122873537381961728.text: Some mainstream publishers, like CNN, have grown their total engagements since then. But so, too, have Breitbart, The Daily Wire, The Daily Mail, and the viral publisher LADbiblehttp://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122873416669962240.text: When Facebook tweaked its ranking system in January 2018, it claimed to be prioritizing “conversations and meaningful interactions between people.” The change was meant to benefit posts from friends and family.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122873078877499398.text: Then came Fox News’ big Facebook moment. “When Trump announced that he was running,” the person added, “that’s when our numbers exploded.”http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872993401774081.text: “We would intentionally post content that would be divisive and elicit a lot of comments,” a former Fox News social producer said, adding that high-engagement posts would inform programming decisions on TV.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872816334966786.text: By diminishing the reach of a constellation of largely right-wing, fringe sites, Facebook may have effectively redirected some users’ attention toward Fox News.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872759753814017.text: This cleanup effort could be inadvertently boosting Fox, said Robert Faris, who studies digital communication as the research director at Harvard’s Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Societyhttp://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872665377771522.text: Fox News may also be benefiting from Facebook’s effort to clean up its act. Soon after the 2016 election, as fears around misinformation hit a fever pitch, Facebook began turning its dials to screen out so-called fake news and conspiracies.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872547517902849.text:
Facebook, for its part, concedes Fox News knows what it’s doing.

“Fox clearly has different methods with connecting with people than other publishers might,” a Facebook spokesman saidhttp://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872364520357894.text: This is what engagement rate on FoX News' page looked like on Mueller day compared to other outlets http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8 pic.twitter.com/7bBw6Iv20Q

1122872072517111809.text: The Fox page’s engagement rate — the average number of engagements per post per follower — was higher than any major news organization over the same period, and some five times that of The New York Times.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8

1122872015235555331.text: Over the past three years, Crowdtangle estimates that Fox News’ main Facebook page, with 17 million followers, has racked up 80 percent more reactions, comments, and shares than CNN, which has 31 million followers.http://bit.ly/2XSPGw8
